c74object.name: ears.-~
c74object.description: Subtracts a given number, envelope or buffer from buffer samples.

inlet.digest: Second operand factor(s), envelope(s) or buffer(s)

objarg.name: outnames
objarg.description: The outname attribute sets a name (or a wrapped list of names) for each of the buffer outles of the objects in ears. These names are only accounted for if the alloc mode is 'Static'.

objarg.name: operand
objarg.description: Sets an optional initial number or envelope to be used as second operand.

method.name: (mouse)
method.description: Double-clicking on the object will open the display window for the output buffer(s). If more than 10 buffers are to be output, only the first 10 are displayed.

method.name: number
method.description: A number in the second inlet sets a constant second operand

method.name: reset
method.description: If the alloc attribute is set to 'Dynamic', the reset message will force the dynamic naming to cycle and restart from the first used buffer name. This is especially useful in combination with iterative mechanisms.

method.name: stop
method.description: When a stop message is sent to an object with blocking attribute set to 0, the computation is aborted as soon as possible.

method.name: symbol/list/llll
method.description:
A symbol, list or llll in the first inlet is supposed to contain buffer names and will trigger the buffer processing and output the processed buffer names (depending on the alloc attribute).
A symbol in the second inlet is expected to contain the name of the buffer to be used as a second operand. A number or an llll in the second inlet is expected to contain respectively the numeric operand or the operand in the form of an envelope.

method.name: write
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer, default), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

attribute.name: blocking
envtimeunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for time values inside envelopes: Milliseconds, Samples, Relative (0. to 1. as a percentage of the buffer length). The default is Relative.

attribute.name: outname
attribute.description: Sets the name for each one of the buffer outlets. Leave blank to auto-assign unique names.

attribute.name: polyout
resamplingmode
attribute.description: Sets the resampling mode (Sinc, Nearest Neighbor, Sample and Hold, Linear, Quadratic or Cubic). The default is "Sinc", which provides bandlimited interpolation.

attribute.name: resamplingpolicy
attribute.description: Sets the resampling policy used when buffers have different sample rates: "Don't" (no resampling - beware: temporality is not preserved!), "To lowest" (buffers are to the lowest sample rate), "To highest" (buffers are converted to the highest sample rate), "To most common" (buffers are to the most common sample rate), "To Max Current" (buffers are converted to the current Max sample rate).

attribute.name: scalarmode
attribute.description: If set, a single number, envelope or buffer is iterated against all the incoming buffers.

attribute.name: slopemapping
attribute.description: Sets the function to be used for slope mapping: either bach (default) or Max.
